circumstances: While on a night approach to Houston Airport, the pilot encountered poor weather conditions with low clouds and fog. He descended too low until the aircraft collided with ground about two miles short of runway. All three passengers were injured while the pilot was killed.
probable_cause:
Controlled flight into terrain on final approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Misread instruments or failed to read, 
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Limited visibility to 1/2 mile or less, 
- Sky obscured, 
- Descended into ground about 2 miles short of runway in below minima conditions.
